programme.title: Anzac Day: Villers-Bretonneux Dawn Service 2024
programme.desc: One of the key commemorative events on Anzac Day. From the Australian National Memorial in Villers-Bretonneux, France - the 2024 Service honours the service and sacrifice by Australians on the Western Front in WWI.

programme.title: AFL Premiership Season - Round 7 - Essendon v Collingwood Ep42
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - 100,000 fans are expected at the MCG as Essendon take on Collingwood in the traditional Anzac Day match. The Bombers sit 7th with 4 wins and 2 losses while the 10th placed Magpies won 3 straight after losing their first 3.

programme.title: Stuff The British Stole - Shadow Boxer Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - In a mystery binding together China, UK & Australia, British colonial forces took a golden warrior statue following an epic rebellion by Chinese martial artists. But how did it end up in a prestigious Australian building?

programme.title: The Pacific Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - We uncover a vast trove of Pacific remains being held by Australian universities and museums and the push to repatriate them. Plus we go to New Caledonia where voting laws could be altered, upending the independence movement.

programme.title: Governor-General's Anzac Day Message 2024
programme.desc: The Anzac Day Message by the Governor-General of Australia, His Excellency General the Honourable David Hurley AC DSC (Retd).

programme.title: AFL Premiership Season - Round 7 - GWS v Brisbane Lions Ep43
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Thursday Night Footy in Canberra as GWS host Brisbane on Anzac Day. The Giants lost their first game of the season to Carlton last weekend to fall to 3rd, while the 12th placed Lions lost to the Cats and have 2 wins 4 losses.

programme.title: The World Ep68
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - There's never been a more important time to stay in touch with what's happening in our world. Now at the new earlier time of 9pm AEST, Beverley O'Connor presents the latest international news from correspondents and guests.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep64
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

programme.title: ABC Late News Ep84
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. We've got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Jade Barker.

programme.title: The Pacific Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - We uncover a vast trove of Pacific remains being held by Australian universities and museums and the push to repatriate them. Plus we go to New Caledonia where voting laws could be altered, upending the independence movement.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show Ep9
programme.desc: Sr. 4 - Tiana Penitani and Sam Wykes are joined by NRL player Sia Soliola, the cricket program empowering Samoan women, and fun playing aqua rugby.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep64
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

programme.title: The Many Days Of Anzac
programme.desc: The ABC dives into its archives of its Anzac Day coverage to reveal the story of how Australians created Anzac traditions and rituals by which we remember those who fought.

programme.title: Breaking the Code: Cyber Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Australian spies are on the offensive against cyber criminal networks and foreign actors seeking to disrupt democracies. But our intelligence agencies have a long history playing a key role in secret battles.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight Ep84
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Know the latest on the day's top stories, as Jade Barker brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: War Stories - Glencoe Heiress Ep5
programme.desc: Sr. 2021 - Many Australian soldiers wounded in the first world war were sent to an English estate to recuperate. An Australian wool heiress who used her $40m fortune to care for 50,000 wounded ANZACs. Landline's Bec Whetham reports.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep64
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

programme.title: The World Ep68
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - There's never been a more important time to stay in touch with what's happening in our world. Now at the new earlier time of 9pm AEST, Beverley O'Connor presents the latest international news from correspondents and guests.

programme.title: News Breakfast Ep85
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Be the first to know the latest overnight developments, breaking news and the top stories this morning. Michael Rowland and Bridget Brennan bring you news and interviews, Charles Brice with sport and Nate Byrne with weather.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings Ep85
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - When big stories break, turn to Dan Bourchier in the morning to bring you what's happening and why it matters. ABC News has more reporters in more places, serving and connecting communities and telling your stories.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon Ep85
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - The leading news at lunchtime. Ruby Cornish brings you the day's top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Gardening Australia - Hanging Baskets, Frog Hotel & Maize Magic Ep19
programme.desc: Sr. 32 - Sophie Thomson visits a gospel church group growing maize, Josh Byrne builds a 'hotel' for frogs, Clarence Slockee grows native plants in hanging baskets and Jane Edmanson shares her tips on pruning citrus.

programme.title: Dream Gardens - Woodend, VIC Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 3 - A young family turns their back on city life for a home with a garden spacious enough to accommodate all their needs. But can they balance a myriad of ideas to delight both parents and children?

programme.title: Adam And Poh's Malaysia In Australia - Episode 4 Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Adam and Poh are on Bruny Island with cheesemaker and brewer Nick Haddow. Then Adam heads to Mudgee to explore Australian native ingredients. Back in the kitchen, Adam and Poh make Chicken Satay with Nyonya Peanut Sauce.

programme.title: The Pacific Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - We uncover a vast trove of Pacific remains being held by Australian universities and museums and the push to repatriate them. Plus we go to New Caledonia where voting laws could be altered, upending the independence movement.

programme.title: That Pacific Sports Show Ep9
programme.desc: Sr. 4 - Tiana Penitani and Sam Wykes are joined by NRL player Sia Soliola, the cricket program empowering Samoan women, and fun playing aqua rugby.

programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Take a closer look at what's making headlines in regional and rural Australia. ABC News reporters uncover the news and unique stories about what's really going on outside the big cities. Presented by Amy Culpitt.

programme.title: Australian Story - Patient Zero - Richard Scolyer Ep7
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Australian Story checks in on 2024 Australian of the Year Professor Richard Scolyer as he reaches a remarkable milestone in his revolutionary cancer treatment.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia - Bullsbrook Ep7
programme.desc: Sr. 10 - After selling their medieval style family home known as the 'Sand Castle' in Perth's City Beach, Tani and pilot husband Tim have plan to build an 'earth castle' on their 60 acre property north of Perth.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia - North Melbourne Ep8
programme.desc: Sr. 10 - Architect Ben and artist wife Tania, get creative buying a tiny 64 square metre discarded scrap of land in one of North Melbourne's grittier back lanes. They plan to build a three storey, three bedroom, two bathroom home.

programme.title: If You're Listening - How Knocking Down Houses Avoided a Housing Crisis Ep8
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - 30 years ago, property in Tokyo was the most expensive in the world. Now home ownership is comparatively affordable with plenty of available stock. How was this massive turnaround achieved and what can we learn from Japan?

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent - Time Bomb - The Pacific Ep7
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Eighty years since Japan and the Allied forces waged a battle at Guadalcanal, Solomon Islanders are still paying the price with thousands of unexploded devices left behind and the threat of leaking oil from rusting warships.

programme.title: AFL Premiership Season - Round 7 - Geelong Cats v Carlton Blues Ep45
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Geelong are the only undefeated team remaining in 2024. After six straight wins the Cats take on Carlton at the MCG in Saturday Twilight Footy. The Blues sit 4th with 5 wins and 1 loss after beating previously undefeated GWS.

programme.title: AFL Premiership Season - Round 7 - Fremantle v Western Bulldogs Ep46
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - Its 9th v 8th in Saturday Night Footy live from Perth as the Fremantle Dockers host the Western Bulldogs in Round 7. The Dockers have lost 3 in a row, most recently to rival West Coast. Both teams have 3 wins and 3 losses.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Ep11

programme.desc: Sr. 1 - In bustling Canley Heights, Arka's tucks into his dream dish, the Vietnamese crispy-skin chicken noodles and tries some sweet stinky durian with writer Tien Tran, and actors Khoi Trinh and Brandon Nguyen.

programme.title: India Votes 2024 Ep4
programme.desc: Sr. 2024 - We take a look at the state of Indian media. India is home to millions of viewers, numerous news channels and hundreds of newspapers but its ranking in press freedom has been declining. Presented by Hannah Jose.
